### **Clarification of `globals.css`, `layout.js`, and `VerseOfTheDay.js` Structure**
You're asking **why we have both `globals.css` and `layout.js`**, and why **Verse of the Day verses are defined in multiple places**. Let's break it down.

---

## **1Ô∏è‚É£ What `globals.css` and `layout.js` Do**
‚úÖ **`globals.css` ‚Üí Handles Global Styling**  
- Defines **page-wide** CSS, including colors, typography, and UI elements.
- Controls the **background gradient, navbar styles, section layouts, fonts, and animations**.
- Needed for **consistent visual design** across all pages.

‚úÖ **`layout.js` ‚Üí Handles Global Page Structure & Metadata**
- Defines **HTML structure** (like the `<html>` and `<body>` tags).
- Sets up **global metadata (title, description)**.
- Ensures all pages **inherit the same font** (`Geist Sans` and `Geist Mono`).

### **üí° Do You Need Both?**
Yes! **They serve different functions:**
| **File** | **Purpose** |
|---------|------------|
| `globals.css` | Handles visual styles (colors, fonts, background, UI components) |
| `layout.js` | Defines the structure of all pages (HTML setup, global metadata) |

üîπ **TL;DR:** Keep **both** since `layout.js` ensures consistency across pages, while `globals.css` controls how everything looks.

---

## **üîç Possible Issues & Fixes**

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ Next.js `Link` Requires `passHref` for Some Components**
While `Link` usually works fine, some cases require `passHref`.

‚úÖ **Fix: Ensure `passHref` is included for the `Logo` link.**  
Update this part in `Navbar.js`:
```jsx
{/* ‚úÖ Logo linked to home */}
<Link href="/" passHref className="flex items-center">
  <Image
    src="/tlt logo.png"
    alt="Ten Lost Tribes Logo"
    width={160}
    height={50}
    priority
  />
</Link>
```
> **Why?** In some Next.js versions, `passHref` ensures `<a>` elements receive the correct `href` when wrapped in `<Link>`.

---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ CSS Might Be Preventing Clicks**
Sometimes, **z-index issues** or `pointer-events: none;` in CSS prevent clicks.

‚úÖ **Fix: Check global styles for issues**
Make sure `globals.css` or `Navbar.css` doesn‚Äôt have:
```css
.navbar a {
  pointer-events: none;
}
```
If this exists, **remove it or set `pointer-events: auto;`**.

---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Next.js Caching Issue**
Sometimes, Next.js **caches links**, and updates aren‚Äôt reflected immediately.

‚úÖ **Fix: Hard refresh your browser**
- On **Mac:** Press `Cmd + Shift + R`
- On **Windows:** Press `Ctrl + Shift + R`
- If using **Vercel**, redeploy the site:
```sh
git add .
git commit -m "Fixed home button issue"
git push origin main
```

---

### **4Ô∏è‚É£ Page.js Might Not Be Recognized as the Landing Page**
If `/` is returning **404 Not Found**, Next.js may not recognize `page.js` as the landing page.

‚úÖ **Fix: Ensure `app/page.js` Exists & Is Named Correctly**
Your **landing page file should be:**
```plaintext
/tenlosttribes/app/page.js
```
If it's inside another folder (`/home/page.js` instead of `/page.js`), Next.js **won't recognize it as the default landing page**.

---

### **5Ô∏è‚É£ Link Might Not Work in Mobile Menu**
If the Home button works on **desktop but not in mobile**, your `setIsOpen(false)` might be causing issues.

‚úÖ **Fix: Explicitly Close Menu on Click**
Update the mobile menu links:
```jsx
<Link href="/" className="nav-link" onClick={() => setIsOpen(false)}>Home</Link>
```
---

## **üîç Summary of Fixes**
| **Issue** | **Fix** |
|----------|--------|
| `Link` not working properly? | ‚úÖ Add `passHref` |
| Clicks blocked by CSS? | ‚úÖ Ensure `pointer-events: auto;` |
| Cached issue? | ‚úÖ Hard refresh or redeploy |
| `page.js` missing or misplaced? | ‚úÖ Check it exists at `/app/page.js` |
| Mobile menu link issue? | ‚úÖ Ensure `setIsOpen(false)` is applied |

---

4Ô∏è‚É£ **Test if mobile menu link works properly**

the banner is not showing the whole image

---

Your **Banner.js** is using `layout="intrinsic"`, which can cause cropping issues if the container doesn't scale properly. To ensure the **full image** is displayed properly without cutting off parts, try the following fixes:

---

### **üîπ Fix 1: Use `layout="responsive"` Instead**
Instead of `layout="intrinsic"`, **use `layout="responsive"`** so the image scales dynamically while maintaining the aspect ratio.

‚úÖ **Update `Banner.js` like this:**
```jsx
import Image from "next/image";

export default function Banner({ imageSrc, altText, title }) {
  return (
    <div className="banner-container relative w-full">
      <Image
        src={imageSrc}
        alt={altText}
        className="banner-image object-cover"
        layout="responsive"
        width={1920}
        height={1080}
        priority
      />
      {title && (
        <h1 className="banner-title absolute top-1/2 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 text-white text-3xl font-bold">
          {title}
        </h1>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```
‚úÖ **Changes applied:**
- **`layout="responsive"`** ensures the **entire image** is shown.
- **`object-cover`** prevents distortion while keeping the image centered.
- **Centered Title** using `absolute top-1/2 left-1/2`.

---

### **üîπ Fix 2: CSS Adjustments in `globals.css`**
If the banner still **doesn't stretch properly**, add this to your **CSS (`globals.css`)**:
```css
.banner-container {
  width: 100vw; /* Full width of screen */
  height: auto;
  overflow: hidden; /* Prevents scrolling */
}

.banner-image {
  width: 100%;
  height: auto;
  object-fit: cover; /* Ensures full image is displayed without cropping */
}
```

---

### **üîπ Fix 3: Verify `imageSrc` Path**
If the image is **not appearing at all**, make sure:
1. **The image exists inside `/public/`** (e.g., `/public/banner.jpg`).
2. You're passing the **correct path** in `app/page.js`:
```jsx
<Banner imageSrc="/banner.jpg" altText="Ten Lost Tribes Banner" title="The Hidden Kingdom ‚Äì Discover the Ten Tribes" />
```
**‚ùå Wrong:** `"./banner.jpg"` or `"public/banner.jpg"`  
**‚úÖ Correct:** `"/banner.jpg"`

---

### **üöÄ Final Steps**
1Ô∏è‚É£ **Update `Banner.js` with `layout="responsive"` and `object-cover`**.  
2Ô∏è‚É£ **Apply CSS fixes (`globals.css`) for better scaling**.  
3Ô∏è‚É£ **Ensure the image is correctly placed in `/public/banner.jpg`**.  
4Ô∏è‚É£ **Redeploy & test on different screen sizes**.

This will **fix the cut-off issue** and make sure the **entire banner is visible on all devices**. Let me know if you need further refinements! üöÄ

Update **`globals.css`** to **ensure proper layering** and move the scrolling header down:

```css
.tribe-header {
  width: 100%;
  overflow: hidden;
  white-space: nowrap;
  display: flex;
```

- The **tribe header appears below the navbar**.

```js
      </div>
    </section>
  );
}
```

### **üîπ Setting Up a Member Sign-In and Exclusive Content Area**
To create a **member sign-in system** and **restricted content area**, we need:
1. **User Authentication** (Sign-up, Login, Logout)
2. **Protected Routes** (Only logged-in users can access certain pages)
3. **Membership Tiers (Optional Future Expansion)**

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Step 1: Choose an Authentication Method**
Since we are already using **Vercel**, the best options for authentication are:
‚úÖ **Supabase Auth** (Recommended) ‚Äì Open-source, works like Firebase but SQL-based.  
‚úÖ **NextAuth.js** ‚Äì Easy setup with multiple providers (Google, Facebook, Email, etc.).  
‚úÖ **Clerk or Auth0** ‚Äì Paid services, good for scalability.

üëâ I **recommend Supabase** because we already set up **Supabase for data storage**, and it provides authentication + a database.

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Step 2: Install Dependencies**
Run this in your project root:

```bash
npm install @supabase/supabase-js
```

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Step 3: Configure Supabase in `supabaseClient.js`**
Create a new file **`lib/supabaseClient.js`**:

```js
import { createClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';

const supabaseUrl = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL;
const supabaseAnonKey = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;

export const supabase = createClient(supabaseUrl, supabaseAnonKey);
```

üîπ **Make sure** you add your **Supabase URL & Anon Key** in `.env.local`:

```
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key
```

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Step 4: Create Login & Signup Page**
Create **`app/login/page.js`** for the user sign-in page:

```js
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function Login() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleLogin(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setError("");

    const { user, error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({
      email,
      password,
    });

    if (error) {
      setError(error.message);
    } else {
      router.push("/members");
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Member Login</h2>
      <form onSubmit={handleLogin} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input 
          type="email" 
          placeholder="Email" 
          value={email} 
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
        />
        <input 
          type="password" 
          placeholder="Password" 
          value={password} 
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-blue-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-700">
          Login
        </button>
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
      </form>
    </div>
  );
}
```

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Step 5: Create a Member-Only Area**
Create **`app/members/page.js`** for the protected members-only content:

```js
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchUser = async () => {
      const { data: { user } } = await supabase.auth.getUser();
      if (!user) {
        router.push("/login");
      } else {
        setUser(user);
      }
    };
    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    router.push("/login");
  }

  if (!user) return <p>Loading...</p>;

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Welcome, {user.email}</h2>
      <p className="text-lg">You now have access to member-only content.</p>
      <button 
        onClick={handleLogout} 
        className="mt-4 bg-red-500 px-6 py-2 rounded hover:bg-red-700">
        Logout
      </button>
    </div>
  );
}
```

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Step 6: Add Login & Logout to Navbar**
Update **`Navbar.js`** to include login/logout buttons:

```js
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import Link from "next/link";
import Image from "next/image";

export default function Navbar() {
  const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState(false);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchUser = async () => {
      const { data: { user } } = await supabase.auth.getUser();
      setUser(user);
    };
    fetchUser();
  }, []);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    window.location.href = "/login";
  }

  return (
    <nav className="w-full fixed top-0 left-0 z-50 bg-gray-900">
      <div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-between h-16">
          {/* Logo */}
          <Link href="/" passHref>
            <Image
              src="/tlt logo.png"
              alt="Ten Lost Tribes Logo"
              width={240}
              height={80}
              priority
            />
          </Link>

          {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
          <button
            className="text-white sm:hidden focus:outline-none text-5xl"
            onClick={() => setIsOpen(!isOpen)}
          >
            ‚ò∞
          </button>

          {/* Menu Items */}
          <div className={`${
            isOpen ? "block" : "hidden"
          } sm:flex space-x-4 absolute sm:relative top-full left-0 w-full sm:w-auto bg-black sm:bg-transparent p-4 sm:p-0`}>
            <Link href="/" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Home</Link>
            <Link href="/celestial" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Mazzaroth</Link>
            <Link href="/tribes" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Tribes</Link>
            <Link href="/paul" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Paul</Link>
            <Link href="/archive" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Archive</Link>
            {user ? (
              <>
                <Link href="/members" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Members Area</Link>
                <button onClick={handleLogout} className="text-white px-3 py-2 rounded">Logout</button>
              </>
            ) : (
              <Link href="/login" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Login</Link>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
}
```

Your **`.env.local`** file is essential for securely storing your **Supabase API credentials** and ensuring they are not exposed in your codebase.

### **üõ†Ô∏è Check or Create Your `.env.local` File**
Your **`.env.local`** file should be located in the **root directory** of your project.

#### **üìå Steps to Check/Create `.env.local`**
1. **Navigate to your project root in VS Code.**  
   - If you already have a **`.env.local`**, open it.
   - If not, **create a new file** in the root directory called `.env.local`.

2. **Ensure the following keys are present in `.env.local`:**
   ```
   NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
   NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key
   ```

3. **Replace `your_supabase_url` and `your_supabase_anon_key`**  
   - Log into **Supabase**.
   - Go to **Project Settings > API**.
   - Copy **your Supabase URL** and **Anon Key** and paste them into `.env.local`.

---

### **üîπ Important Notes**
‚úÖ **Never commit `.env.local` to Git!**  
   - Add it to **`.gitignore`** so that it remains private:
     ```
     .env.local
     ```

‚úÖ **Restart your development server** after modifying `.env.local`:  
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

‚úÖ **Check if Supabase is working**  
   Run:
   ```bash
   console.log("Supabase URL:", process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL);
   ```
   If it logs `undefined`, your environment variables might not be loading.

### **üõ†Ô∏è Walkthrough: Setting Up Your `.env.local` File for Supabase**
I'll guide you step by step to properly configure your **Supabase environment variables** so your authentication system works.

---

### **üîπ Step 1: Locate or Create `.env.local`**
1. **Open your project in VS Code**  
   Navigate to your **Next.js project root directory** (`tenlosttribes`).
   
2. **Check if `.env.local` already exists**  
   - In VS Code, open the **Explorer (File Browser)** (`Ctrl + Shift + E` on Windows/Linux, `Cmd + Shift + E` on Mac).  
   - Look for `.env.local` in the **root directory**.
   - If it **exists**, open it and go to **Step 2**.
   - If it **doesn‚Äôt exist**, create it:
     - Right-click inside the root directory.
     - Select **New File**.
     - Name it: `.env.local`

---

### **üîπ Step 2: Get Your Supabase Credentials**
1. **Log in to Supabase** ‚Üí [https://supabase.com](https://supabase.com)
2. Select your **Supabase project**.
3. In the left sidebar, click **Project Settings > API**.
4. Copy the following values:
   - **Supabase URL** ‚Üí Found under "Project URL"
   - **Supabase Anon Key** ‚Üí Found under "anon public"

---

### **üîπ Step 3: Add Supabase Credentials to `.env.local`**
Open `.env.local` and paste the following, replacing with your actual Supabase credentials:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key
```
(‚ö†Ô∏è **Replace `your_supabase_url` and `your_supabase_anon_key` with actual values.**)

---

### **üîπ Step 4: Ensure `.env.local` is Ignored by Git**
Your environment file **should NOT be committed to Git** (for security reasons).  

To prevent this:
1. Open your `.gitignore` file (located in your project root).
2. Add the following line if it's not already there:
   ```
   .env.local
   ```

---

### **üîπ Step 5: Restart Your Development Server**
After adding the environment variables, you must **restart Next.js** for the changes to take effect:
```bash
npm run dev
```

---

### **üîπ Step 6: Verify Supabase is Working**
To check if Supabase is correctly reading your environment variables, add this to your **`supabaseClient.js`** file:
```js
console.log("Supabase URL:", process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL);
```
Then, **open your browser console (`F12` > Console tab)** and refresh the page.

If you see **your Supabase URL**, everything is working! üéâ  
If you see `undefined`, **your environment variables are not loading correctly**.

---

Now that your **Supabase authentication is configured**, users can **sign up, log in, and access the members-only area**. If you want to extend functionality (e.g., password resets, role-based access), we can build that next.

### **üîß Fixing the `useState` and `useEffect` Error in Navbar.js**
The error indicates that **your Navbar component needs to be a client component** since it uses **`useState` and `useEffect`**, but it is not marked as such.

---

### **‚úÖ Solution: Add `"use client"`**
To fix this, **add the following directive at the top** of `Navbar.js`:

#### **üìå Updated `Navbar.js`**
```javascript
"use client";  // ‚úÖ This tells Next.js it's a client component

import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import Link from "next/link";
import Image from "next/image";

export default function Navbar() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [menuOpen, setMenuOpen] = useState(false);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchUser = async () => {
      const { data: { user } } = await supabase.auth.getUser();
      setUser(user);
    };
    fetchUser();
  }, []);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    setUser(null);
  }

  return (
    <nav className="fixed top-0 left-0 w-full bg-gray-900 text-white p-4 shadow-lg z-50">
      <div className="container mx-auto flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/">
          <Image src="/logo.png" alt="Logo" width={100} height={50} />
        </Link>
        
        {/* ‚úÖ Hamburger Menu for Mobile */}
        <button onClick={() => setMenuOpen(!menuOpen)} className="md:hidden">
          ‚ò∞
        </button>

        <ul className={`md:flex md:space-x-4 ${menuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"}`}>
          <li><Link href="/">Home</Link></li>
          <li><Link href="/tribes">Tribes</Link></li>
          <li><Link href="/expose">Expos√©</Link></li>
          <li><Link href="/members">Members</Link></li>

          {user ? (
            <li>
              <button onClick={handleLogout} className="text-red-500">Logout</button>
            </li>
          ) : (
            <li><Link href="/login">Login</Link></li>
          )}
        </ul>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
}
```

### **üîí Are Supabase Environment Variables Safe to Expose?**

It depends on **which** Supabase keys you're using. Let's break it down:

---

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`**
‚úÖ **Safe to expose**  
The **Supabase URL** is **publicly accessible** and is needed for frontend requests. It's okay to include this in **`NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`** because all API requests need to know where to send data.

---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY`**
‚ö†Ô∏è **Public but limited**  
The **Anonymous (Anon) Key** allows **read and write access** to your Supabase database **based on Row-Level Security (RLS)** settings.

- If **RLS is enabled**, it's **mostly safe** because it follows the database security rules.  
- If **RLS is disabled**, **anyone with the key can access or modify your data**.

‚úÖ **Solution:**  
- Keep `RLS` **enabled** in **Supabase Database Settings**.
- **Only allow read-access to public data**.
- If you need protected operations, use **a server-side API key** (do **not** expose the `SERVICE_ROLE` key).

---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ What Should NOT Be Exposed?**
‚ùå **DO NOT expose** the `SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY` (Admin Key).  
This **bypasses security** and allows **full access to your database**.

- Never put `SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY` in **`.env.local`** or **Vercel‚Äôs public environment variables**.
- Use this **only on backend/server-side** (e.g., API routes in Next.js).

---

### **4Ô∏è‚É£ Best Practices**
‚úÖ **Public Variables (`NEXT_PUBLIC_...`)**
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY` (if RLS is **enabled**)

‚úÖ **Private Variables (Keep in Backend)**
- `SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY` (Never expose this!)

---

### **5Ô∏è‚É£ Extra Security Tip: Restrict API Access**
In **Supabase Dashboard ‚Üí Authentication ‚Üí Policies**, make sure to:
- **Enable Row-Level Security (RLS)** on your tables.
- **Create policies** that restrict access (e.g., only authenticated users can write data).

---

### **Final Answer:**
Yes, `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL` and `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY` **are safe to expose** as long as **RLS is enabled**. Keep the **service role key** hidden on the backend.

Let me know if you want to set up **better security rules** in Supabase! üöÄ

üîπ **Why?**  
- This prevents **unhandled errors** that can cause a blank page.
- Logs any Supabase **errors to the console**.

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ `Navbar.js` ‚Äî Missing Dependency in `useEffect`**
Your `useEffect` should **include `supabase` as a dependency**:
```javascript
useEffect(() => {
  const fetchUser = async () => {
    const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getUser();
    setUser(data.user);
  };
  fetchUser();
}, [supabase]); // ‚úÖ Add `supabase` here to ensure reactivity
```

üîπ **Why?**  
- Ensures Supabase runs correctly if dependencies update.

---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ `MembersArea.js` ‚Äî Login Redirection Might Break on Server-Side Rendering**
The `router.push("/login")` might cause errors if `user` is `null` at first render. Instead, use **Next.js' `useEffect` hook**:
```javascript
useEffect(() => {
  const fetchUser = async () => {
    const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getUser();
    if (error || !data?.user) {
      router.replace("/login"); // ‚úÖ Prevents full page reload issues
    } else {
      setUser(data.user);
    }
  };
  fetchUser();
}, [router]);
```

üîπ **Why?**  
- `replace("/login")` prevents **"flash of content" before redirect**.
- Prevents a server-side **prerender error**.

---

Your **mobile menu button** toggles visibility using state, but it is missing a CSS transition to animate properly.

- Prevents **layout shift** from an abrupt menu toggle.

### **5Ô∏è‚É£ `Login.js` ‚Äî Supabase Sign-In Bug**
Your login method is missing an error handler for failed logins.

‚úÖ **Modify `handleLogin`:**
```javascript
async function handleLogin(e) {

  setError("");

  });

}
```

---

To add a **"Join" (Sign Up) option** for users who aren't members yet, you need to modify your `Login.js` page to include a **registration (sign-up) form**.

---

### **‚úÖ Modify `Login.js` to Include Sign-Up Option**
This code will allow **users to create an account** if they aren‚Äôt already members.

#### **üìù Updated `Login.js`**
```javascript
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function Login() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [isSigningUp, setIsSigningUp] = useState(false); // üîπ Toggle for Login/Register
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleAuth(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setError("");

    if (isSigningUp) {
      // ‚úÖ Register new user
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.signUp({
        email,
        password,
      });

      if (error) {
        setError(error.message);
      } else {
        alert("Registration successful! Please check your email to verify your account.");
      }
    } else {
      // ‚úÖ Login existing user
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({
        email,
        password,
      });

      if (error) {
        setError("Invalid email or password.");
      } else {
        router.push("/members");
      }
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">{isSigningUp ? "Join Us" : "Member Login"}</h2>
      
      <form onSubmit={handleAuth} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input 
          type="email" 
          placeholder="Email" 
          value={email} 
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <input 
          type="password" 
          placeholder="Password" 
          value={password} 
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-blue-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-700">
          {isSigningUp ? "Sign Up" : "Login"}
        </button>
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
      </form>

      <button 
        onClick={() => setIsSigningUp(!isSigningUp)} 
        className="mt-4 text-blue-400 hover:underline"
      >
        {isSigningUp ? "Already a member? Login here." : "Not a member? Join now."}
      </button>
    </div>
  );
}
```

---

### **üîπ How It Works**
1. **Users can toggle between Login & Sign-Up** by clicking "Not a member? Join now."
2. **If they are signing up**, the form will create an account using `supabase.auth.signUp()`.
3. **If they are logging in**, it uses `supabase.auth.signInWithPassword()`.
4. **New users receive a confirmation email** (handled by Supabase).
5. **After successful login, users are redirected to `/members`.**

---

3. **Check your Supabase authentication settings** to ensure email confirmation is enabled.
4. **Deploy and verify**.

## **üõ† Steps to Fix This Issue**
### **‚úÖ 1Ô∏è‚É£ Check Supabase Environment Variables on Vercel**
Even though you have `.env.local` set up correctly in your local environment, these variables need to be added to **Vercel‚Äôs environment variables**.

#### **üîπ Verify Environment Variables in Vercel**
1. **Go to Vercel Dashboard** ‚Üí Select your project.
2. **Navigate to**: `Settings` ‚Üí `Environment Variables`
3. Make sure these are correctly set:
   - `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`
   - `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY`
4. If any are missing, **add them manually**.
5. **Re-deploy** after saving changes.

### **‚úÖ 2Ô∏è‚É£ Ensure Supabase Calls Don't Block Static Generation**
Your **`MembersArea.js`** and **`Navbar.js`** fetch user data inside `useEffect()`, but this only works in **client-side rendering**. If a page expects this data at **build time**, it can hang.

#### **üîπ Fix: Ensure Static Pages Don‚Äôt Try to Fetch Auth Data**
Modify your `useEffect` in **`Navbar.js`** and **`MembersArea.js`** to make sure they do not break the build process.

```javascript
            <Link href="/tribes" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Tribes</Link>
            <Link href="/paul" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Paul</Link>
            <Link href="/archive" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Archive</Link>
            {user ? (
              <>
                <Link href="/members" className="text-white block px-3 py-2 rounded">Members Area</Link>
                <button onClick={handleLogout} className="text-white px-3 py-2 rounded">Logout</button>
              </>
            ) : (

            )}
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
}
```
‚úÖ **Fixes:**
- Added `if (typeof window !== "undefined")` to **prevent breaking at build time**.

---

**üîß Fix for `MembersArea.js`**
```javascript
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    if (typeof window !== "undefined") { // ‚úÖ Fix: Prevents breaking during static build
      const fetchUser = async () => {
        const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getUser();
        if (error || !data?.user) {
          router.replace("/login"); // Redirect non-authenticated users
        } else {
          setUser(data.user);
        }
      };
      fetchUser();
    }
  }, [router]);

  if (!user) return <p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>;

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
        <button onClick={handleLogout} className="bg-red-500 px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-red-700">Logout</button>
      </nav>

      <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center flex-grow text-center">
        <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-4">Welcome, {user.email}</h2>
        <p className="text-lg">You now have access to exclusive member-only content.</p>

        <div className="mt-6 p-6 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
          <h3 className="text-2xl font-semibold">Exclusive Resources</h3>
          <p className="mt-2">Access special studies, discussions, and more.</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```
‚úÖ **Fixes:**
- Prevents `useEffect` from running during **static build** by checking `typeof window !== "undefined"`.

---

### **‚úÖ 3Ô∏è‚É£ Check for Any Pages That Expect Data at Build Time**
Next.js **pre-builds static pages** unless **`use client`** or **`getServerSideProps`** is explicitly used. 

- **Possible issue**: If any page is trying to fetch Supabase data **on build time**, it will stall.
- **Solution**: Convert all dynamic Supabase data retrieval to **client-side rendering**.

To add a **Reset Password** feature, we need to implement password recovery using Supabase's built-in authentication system. Here‚Äôs the approach:

### **Steps to Add Reset Password Functionality**
1. **Update the Login Page (`app/login/page.js`)**  
   - Add a "Forgot Password?" link that directs users to a reset page.
2. **Create a Password Reset Page (`app/reset-password/page.js`)**  
   - This will send a password reset email via Supabase.
3. **Handle Supabase Magic Link for Reset**  
   - When users receive the email, they click the link and are redirected back to a confirmation page.

---

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ Modify the Login Page**
Modify `app/login/page.js` to include a **Forgot Password?** link.

#### **Updated `app/login/page.js`**
```jsx
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function Login() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [isSigningUp, setIsSigningUp] = useState(false);
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleAuth(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setError("");

    if (isSigningUp) {
      const { error } = await supabase.auth.signUp({ email, password });
      if (error) {
        setError(error.message);
      } else {
        alert("Registration successful! Please check your email to verify your account.");
      }
    } else {
      const { error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({ email, password });
      if (error) {
        setError("Invalid email or password.");
      } else {
        router.push("/members");
      }
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 w-full flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
      </nav>

      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">{isSigningUp ? "Join Us" : "Member Login"}</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleAuth} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="email"
          placeholder="Email"
          value={email}
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <input
          type="password"
          placeholder="Password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-blue-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-700">
          {isSigningUp ? "Sign Up" : "Login"}
        </button>
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
      </form>

      <button onClick={() => setIsSigningUp(!isSigningUp)} className="mt-4 text-blue-400 hover:underline">
        {isSigningUp ? "Already a member? Login here." : "Not a member? Join now."}
      </button>

      {/* üîπ Forgot Password Link */}
      {!isSigningUp && (
        <Link href="/reset-password" className="mt-4 text-yellow-400 hover:underline">
          Forgot Password?
        </Link>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```
---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Create the Reset Password Page**
Now, create a new page:  
üìå **`app/reset-password/page.js`**

#### **`app/reset-password/page.js`**
```jsx
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function ResetPassword() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");

  async function handleReset(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setMessage("");
    setError("");

    const { error } = await supabase.auth.resetPasswordForEmail(email, {
      redirectTo: `${window.location.origin}/update-password`,
    });

    if (error) {
      setError(error.message);
    } else {
      setMessage("Check your email for the password reset link.");
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 w-full flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
      </nav>

      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Reset Your Password</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleReset} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="email"
          placeholder="Enter your email"
          value={email}
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-yellow-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-yellow-700">Send Reset Link</button>
        {message && <p className="text-green-400 mt-2">{message}</p>}
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
      </form>

      <Link href="/login" className="mt-4 text-blue-400 hover:underline">Back to Login</Link>
    </div>
  );
}
```
---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Create the Update Password Page**
Once users click the reset link in their email, they'll land on this page.

üìå **`app/update-password/page.js`**

#### **`app/update-password/page.js`**
```jsx
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function UpdatePassword() {
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleUpdatePassword(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setMessage("");
    setError("");

    const { error } = await supabase.auth.updateUser({ password });

    if (error) {
      setError(error.message);
    } else {
      setMessage("Password updated successfully. You can now log in.");
      setTimeout(() => router.push("/login"), 2000);
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Update Your Password</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleUpdatePassword} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="password"
          placeholder="New Password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-green-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-green-700">Update Password</button>
        {message && <p className="text-green-400 mt-2">{message}</p>}
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
      </form>
    </div>
  );
}
```

Instead of:

If your project structure follows `src/` convention, the correct import should be:

```js
import ResetPasswordForm from "@/app/components/ResetPasswordForm";
```
If that doesn't work, try:
```js
import ResetPasswordForm from "../../components/ResetPasswordForm";
```

#### ‚úÖ **3. Ensure Case Sensitivity**
If your OS is **case-insensitive** (like macOS), but Vercel's environment is **case-sensitive**, ensure your filename matches exactly:
- `ResetPasswordForm.js` **must** match the import exactly.

#### ‚úÖ **4. Restart the Server**
After making these changes, restart your local dev server:
```sh
npm run dev
```
If everything works locally, commit and push your changes, then **trigger a new build on Vercel**.

## **Differences Between Reset and Update Password Pages**

2. **Update Password (`update-password/page.js`)**
   - This page allows the user to **set a new password after clicking the reset link**.
   - It must ensure the Supabase session is valid for updating the password.

### **3. Ensure Update Password Works**
Your **Update Password Page (`update-password/page.js`)** should actually change the password.

#### ‚úÖ **Fix: Ensure Supabase Session is Active**
Modify **`update-password/page.js`** to check for an active session before updating:

```js
"use client";
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function UpdatePassword() {
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [session, setSession] = useState(null);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    const getSession = async () => {
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();
      if (error) {
        setError("Session error: " + error.message);
      } else {
        setSession(data.session);
      }
    };
    getSession();
  }, []);

  async function handleUpdatePassword(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setMessage("");
    setError("");

    if (!session) {
      setError("Invalid session. Try resetting your password again.");
      return;
    }

    const { error } = await supabase.auth.updateUser({ password });

    if (error) {
      setError(error.message);
    } else {
      setMessage("Your password has been updated. Redirecting to login...");
      setTimeout(() => router.push("/login"), 3000);
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Set a New Password</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleUpdatePassword} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="password"
          placeholder="New password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button type="submit" className="w-full bg-green-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-green-700">
          Update Password
        </button>
      </form>

      {message && <p className="text-green-400 mt-2">{message}</p>}
      {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
    </div>
  );
}
```
---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Fix `ResetPasswordForm.js`**
#### **Possible Issue: `supabase.auth.resetPasswordForEmail(email);`**
This function may **not work properly if email confirmations are not enabled** in Supabase. Also, Supabase's latest versions sometimes require additional parameters.

‚úî **Fix: Modify the function like this**:
```js
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";

export default function ResetPasswordForm() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");

  async function handleReset(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setMessage("");
    setError("");

    const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.resetPasswordForEmail(email, {
      redirectTo: `${window.location.origin}/update-password`
    });

    if (error) {
      setError("Error: " + error.message);
    } else {
      setMessage("Check your email for the reset link.");
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Reset Password</h2>
      <form onSubmit={handleReset} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="email"
          placeholder="Enter your email"
          value={email}
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-blue-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-700">
          Send Reset Link
        </button>
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
        {message && <p className="text-yellow-400 mt-2">{message}</p>}
      </form>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Fix `UpdatePassword.js`**
#### **Possible Issue: `supabase.auth.updateUser({ password })`**
The `updateUser` function **only works if the user is already logged in**, but after a reset, they may not be. You must get the session token.

‚úî **Fix: Modify `UpdatePassword.js` like this**:
```js
"use client";

import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";

export default function UpdatePassword() {
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const [session, setSession] = useState(null);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchSession() {
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();
      if (data?.session) {
        setSession(data.session);
      } else {
        setError("Session expired. Please reset your password again.");
      }
    }
    fetchSession();
  }, []);

  async function handleUpdatePassword(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setMessage("");
    setError("");

    if (!session) {
      setError("Invalid session. Try resetting your password again.");
      return;
    }

    const { error } = await supabase.auth.updateUser({ password });

    if (error) {
      setError(error.message);
    } else {
      setMessage("Your password has been updated. Redirecting to login...");
      setTimeout(() => router.push("/login"), 3000);
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Set a New Password</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleUpdatePassword} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="password"
          placeholder="New password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button type="submit" className="w-full bg-green-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-green-700">
          Update Password
        </button>
      </form>

      {message && <p className="text-green-400 mt-2">{message}</p>}
      {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
    </div>
  );
}
```

These props are no longer valid in **Next.js 13+.** Instead, the correct way is:

```js
<Image src="/image.jpg" fill style={{ objectFit: "cover" }} alt="Description" />
```

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Bulk Replace the Deprecated Props**

```js
layout="fill"
```

```js
fill
```

#### **Find:**
```js
objectFit="
```

#### **Replace With:**

```js
style={{ objectFit: "
```

#### **Find:**

```js
" />
```

#### **Replace With:**

```js
"}} />
```

In your **VS Code**, manually update your `next/image` components.

```js
<Image src="/scapegoat.jpg" fill style={{ objectFit: "cover" }} alt="Scapegoat Image" />
```

The issue occurs because **Supabase is sending the password reset email with a `localhost` URL**, which is correct for **local development**, but **incorrect when deployed**. 

---

### ‚úÖ **Fix: Update Supabase Auth Redirect URL**
You need to **configure the correct site URL** in Supabase so that reset links work properly in production.

#### **1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to Supabase Dashboard**
1. **Login to Supabase** ‚Üí [https://supabase.com/dashboard](https://supabase.com/dashboard)
2. **Select your project** (the one linked to your site).
3. On the left sidebar, **go to Authentication ‚Üí URL Configuration**.

#### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Add Allowed Redirect URLs**
Under **Redirect URLs**, add:
```plaintext
http://localhost:3000
https://your-live-site.vercel.app
https://your-custom-domain.com
```
Example:
- **For local testing**: `http://localhost:3000`
- **For production** (on Vercel): `https://tenlosttribes.vercel.app`
- **For custom domain**: `https://yourdomain.com`

üö® **Important:** If you don‚Äôt add these, Supabase will default to `localhost`.

---

#### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Update Password Reset Email Link in Code**
Ensure that **the reset password link** sent in the email points to the correct domain.

Go to your `lib/supabaseClient.js` file and update the `resetPasswordForEmail` function:

#### **üîπ Fix the Reset Email URL**
Modify your code in **reset-password/page.js**:

```js
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";

async function sendPasswordReset(email) {
  const { error } = await supabase.auth.resetPasswordForEmail(email, {
    redirectTo: "https://yourdomain.com/update-password", // Use production domain
  });

  if (error) {
    console.error("Error sending reset email:", error.message);
  } else {

  }
}
```

Your error is caused by a **permissions issue** when trying to install the Vercel CLI globally. This happens because `npm` is trying to write files to `/usr/local/lib/node_modules/`, which requires **admin permissions**.

---

### **Fix: Install Vercel CLI Without Permission Issues**
Try one of these **three solutions**:

#### **Option 1: Use `sudo` (Recommended)**
Run:
```sh
sudo npm install -g vercel
```
You will be prompted to enter your **Mac password**. This gives `npm` the necessary permissions to install globally.

---

#### **Option 2: Change `npm` Default Directory**
If you **don‚Äôt want to use `sudo`**, you can change the default install location to avoid permission issues.

1. Create a new directory for global packages:
   ```sh
   mkdir -p ~/.npm-global
   ```
2. Configure npm to use this directory:
   ```sh
   npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
   ```
3. Add it to your system‚Äôs `PATH`:
   ```sh
   export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH
   ```
4. Reload your shell:
   ```sh
   source ~/.zshrc  # If you use Zsh
   ```
   OR
   ```sh
   source ~/.bashrc  # If you use Bash
   ```
5. Now, install Vercel:
   ```sh
   npm install -g vercel
   ```

---

#### **Option 3: Use `npx` Without Installing Globally**
If you **only need Vercel for this project**, you can avoid installation altogether:
```sh
npx vercel --prod
```
This will run Vercel **without** installing it globally.

---

### **Test Your Installation**
After **any of the above solutions**, check if Vercel is installed:
```sh
vercel --version
```
It should return a version number.

---

### **Deploy After Fixing**
Once installed, deploy your changes:
```sh
vercel --prod
```

### **Fix for New User Signup Redirecting to Reset Password Instead of Confirmation**  

It looks like **new users are being sent to the reset password page instead of a confirmation page** after signing up. This usually happens if the Supabase authentication flow isn't properly handling new user signups versus password resets.

---

### **‚úÖ Step 1: Fix the Supabase Signup Function**
Modify your signup function to ensure **new users receive a confirmation email instead of a reset link.**  

#### **Go to your signup function (e.g., `signup.js` or `RegisterForm.js`)**
Make sure it **requests email confirmation** like this:
```javascript
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";

async function signUpUser(email, password) {
  const { error } = await supabase.auth.signUp({
    email,
    password,
    options: {
      emailRedirectTo: "https://tenlosttribes.com/confirm", // ‚úÖ Correct confirmation link
    },
  });

  if (error) {
    console.error("Error signing up:", error.message);
  } else {
    alert("Check your email to confirm your account!");
  }
}
```
‚úÖ **Key Fix:**
- **`emailRedirectTo` should go to** `"https://tenlosttribes.com/confirm"`
- NOT `update-password` (which is for **password resets**)

### **‚úÖ Fixed `members/page.js`**
```javascript
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchUser() {
      setLoading(true);
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();

      if (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching user:", error.message);
        setLoading(false);
      }

      if (data?.session?.user) {
        setUser(data.session.user);
      } else {
        router.replace("/login");
      }

      setLoading(false);
    }

    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    router.push("/login");
  }

  if (loading) return <p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>;

  if (!user) return null; // Avoid rendering if user data isn't available

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      {/* ‚úÖ Navigation */}
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
        <button
          onClick={handleLogout}
          className="bg-red-500 px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-red-700"
        >
          Logout
        </button>
      </nav>

      {/* ‚úÖ Member Content */}
      <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center flex-grow text-center">
        <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-4">Welcome, {user.email}</h2>
        <p className="text-lg">You now have access to exclusive member-only content.</p>

        {/* üîπ Placeholder for Member Content */}
        <div className="mt-6 p-6 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
          <h3 className="text-2xl font-semibold">Exclusive Resources</h3>
          <p className="mt-2">Access special studies, discussions, and more.</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

‚úÖ **Fixed session check logic** to avoid unnecessary redirects.  
‚úÖ **Added better error handling** if `supabase.auth.getSession()` fails.  
‚úÖ **Prevented infinite re-renders** by ensuring redirects happen only when necessary.

```javascript
"use client";

import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function UpdatePassword() {
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleUpdatePassword(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setMessage("");
    setError("");

    const { error } = await supabase.auth.updateUser({ password });

    if (error) {
      setError(error.message);
    } else {
      setMessage("Your password has been updated. Redirecting to login...");
      setTimeout(() => router.push("/login"), 3000);
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Set a New Password</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleUpdatePassword} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="password"
          placeholder="New password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button type="submit" className="w-full bg-green-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-green-700">
          Update Password
        </button>
      </form>

      {message && <p className="text-green-400 mt-2">{message}</p>}
      {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
    </div>
  );
}
```

```javascript
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function Login() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [password, setPassword] = useState("");
  const [error, setError] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleLogin(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setError("");

    const { error } = await supabase.auth.signInWithPassword({ email, password });
    if (error) {
      setError("Invalid email or password.");
    } else {
      router.push("/members");
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 w-full flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
      </nav>

      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Member Login</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleLogin} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg shadow-lg">
        <input
          type="email"
          placeholder="Email"
          value={email}
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <input
          type="password"
          placeholder="Password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />
        <button className="w-full bg-blue-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-700">
          Login
        </button>
        {error && <p className="text-red-400 mt-2">{error}</p>}
      </form>

      <Link href="/reset-password" className="mt-4 text-yellow-400 hover:underline">
        Forgot Password?
      </Link>

      <Link href="/signup" className="mt-4 text-blue-400 hover:underline">
        Not a member? Join now.
      </Link>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### **üìå Step 4: Update the Supabase Auth Flow**
Since users now **must confirm their email before logging in**, modify `supabaseClient.js` to **prevent unconfirmed users from logging in**.

```javascript
export const supabase = createClient(supabaseUrl, supabaseAnonKey, {

    autoRefreshToken: true,
    persistSession: true,
    detectSessionInUrl: true, 
  },
});
```
üîπ **Note:** Supabase **automatically blocks unconfirmed users** unless `allow_unconfirmed_email_sign_in` is enabled in the Supabase Auth settings.

| **Signup & Login are in one file** | ‚úÖ Created **separate signup page** (`/signup`) |

| **Signup was redirecting users incorrectly** | ‚úÖ Used `emailRedirectTo: "https://tenlosttribes.com/confirm-signup"` |

| **Reset password emails went to wrong page** | ‚úÖ Fixed `redirectTo: "https://tenlosttribes.com/update-password"` |

doesnt supabase need those urls

---



---

Yes, Supabase requires the environment variables `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL` and `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY` to function correctly. From your `supabaseClient.js` file:

```javascript
const supabaseUrl = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL;
const supabaseAnonKey = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;

if (!supabaseUrl || !supabaseAnonKey) {
  console.error("‚ùå Supabase environment variables are missing!");
  throw new Error("Supabase environment variables are missing.");
}
```

This check ensures that Supabase will **not** work if these variables are missing.

### **Troubleshooting**
1. **Verify that the variables are set in `.env.local`**
   - Run:
     ```sh
     cat .env.local
     ```
   - You should see:
     ```
     NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-supabase-url.supabase.co
     NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your-anon-key
     ```

2. **Ensure the environment variables are set in Vercel**
   - Go to **Vercel Dashboard** ‚Üí **Project Settings** ‚Üí **Environment Variables**
   - Add:
     - `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL`
     - `NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY`
   - Deploy again:
     ```sh
     git add .
     git commit -m "Added missing Supabase env variables"
     git push origin main
     vercel --prod
     ```

3. **Check for Local Issues**
   - Restart your development server after setting `.env.local`:
     ```sh
     npm run dev
     ```
   - Run:
     ```sh
     console.log("Supabase URL:", process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL);
     ```
   - If it's `undefined`, the `.env.local` file is not loading correctly.

If the issue persists, let me know and we can debug further! üöÄ

```javascript
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";

export default function Signup() {

        </button>

      </form>

      <Link href="/login" className="mt-4 text-blue-400 hover:underline">
        Already a member? Login here.
      </Link>
    </div>
  );
```

```javascript
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileComplete, setProfileComplete] = useState(false);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchUser() {
      setLoading(true);
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();

      if (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching user:", error.message);
        setLoading(false);
      }

      if (data?.session?.user) {
        setUser(data.session.user);
        checkProfileCompletion(data.session.user.id);
      } else {
        router.replace("/login");
      }

      setLoading(false);
    }

    async function checkProfileCompletion(userId) {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from("profiles")
        .select("birthdate, tribe, learning_path")
        .eq("id", userId)
        .single();

      if (data && data.birthdate && data.tribe && data.learning_path) {
        setProfileComplete(true);
      }
    }

    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    router.push("/login");
  }

  if (loading) return <p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>;

  if (!user) return null;

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      {/* üîπ Navigation */}
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
        <button onClick={handleLogout} className="bg-red-500 px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-red-700">
          Logout
        </button>
      </nav>

      {/* üîπ Member Dashboard */}
      <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center flex-grow text-center">
        <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-4">Welcome, {user.email}</h2>

        {profileComplete ? (
          <>
```

#### **üîπ Profile Setup Page Code**
```javascript
"use client";
import { useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";

export default function ProfileSetup() {
  const [birthdate, setBirthdate] = useState("");
  const [learningPath, setLearningPath] = useState("");
  const router = useRouter();

  async function handleProfileSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();

    const { user } = await supabase.auth.getUser();

    if (!user) {
      alert("Error: You must be logged in.");
      return;
    }

    const { error } = await supabase
      .from("profiles")
      .update({ birthdate, learning_path: learningPath })
      .eq("id", user.id);

    if (error) {
      console.error("Error updating profile:", error.message);
    } else {
      alert("Profile updated! You can now start learning.");
      router.push("/members");
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6">Complete Your Profile</h2>

      <form onSubmit={handleProfileSubmit} className="w-80 bg-gray-800 p-6 rounded-lg">
        <label className="block text-left mb-2">Birthdate:</label>
        <input
          type="date"
          value={birthdate}
          onChange={(e) => setBirthdate(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        />

        <label className="block text-left mb-2">Choose Your Learning Path:</label>
        <select
          value={learningPath}
          onChange={(e) => setLearningPath(e.target.value)}
          className="w-full p-3 mb-3 bg-gray-700 rounded"
          required
        >
          <option value="">Select a Path</option>
          <option value="Minister Training">Minister Training</option>
          <option value="Leadership">Leadership</option>
          <option value="Self-Sufficiency">Self-Sufficiency</option>
        </select>

        <button className="w-full bg-blue-600 p-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-700">
          Submit
        </button>
      </form>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```javascript
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import ProfileForm from "@/components/ProfileForm";

export default function ProfileSetup() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchUser() {
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();
      if (error) console.error("Error fetching user:", error.message);
      if (data?.session?.user) {
        setUser(data.session.user);
      } else {
        router.push("/login");
      }
    }
    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  if (!user) return <p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>;

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <ProfileForm userId={user.id} />
    </div>
  );
}
```

```javascript
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileComplete, setProfileComplete] = useState(false);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchUser() {
      setLoading(true);
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();
      if (error) console.error("Error fetching user:", error.message);
      if (data?.session?.user) {
        setUser(data.session.user);
        checkProfileCompletion(data.session.user.id);
      } else {
        router.replace("/login");
      }
      setLoading(false);
    }

    async function checkProfileCompletion(userId) {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from("profiles")
        .select("birthdate, tribe, learning_path")
        .eq("id", userId)
        .single();

      if (data && data.birthdate && data.tribe && data.learning_path) {
        setProfileComplete(true);
      } else {
        router.push("/profile-setup");
      }
    }

    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    router.push("/login");
  }

  if (loading) return <p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>;
  if (!user) return null;

  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      {/* üîπ Navigation */}
      <nav className="bg-gray-800 p-4 flex justify-between items-center">
        <Link href="/" className="text-white text-lg font-bold">Home</Link>
        <button onClick={handleLogout} className="bg-red-500 px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-red-700">
          Logout
        </button>
      </nav>

      {/* üîπ Member Dashboard */}
      <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center flex-grow text-center">
        <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-4">Welcome, {user.email}</h2>
        <p className="text-lg">You are on your journey in the Tribe of {user.tribe}.</p>
        <Link href="/learning-path">
          <button className="mt-4 bg-green-600 px-6 py-3 rounded-lg hover:bg-green-700">
            Continue Learning
          </button>
        </Link>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

Yes, you need to create a **`profiles`** table in Supabase manually before storing user data. Supabase does not automatically create tables for you. Below are the **steps** and **SQL commands** you need to run.

---

## **1Ô∏è‚É£ Creating the `profiles` Table in Supabase**
### **Step 1: Open Supabase SQL Editor**
1. Go to [Supabase](https://app.supabase.com/)
2. Select your project.
3. Navigate to **SQL Editor** in the left panel.
4. Click **New Query** and enter the following:

### **Step 2: Run the SQL Command**
```sql
CREATE TABLE profiles (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    birthdate DATE NOT NULL,
    tribe TEXT,
    learning_path TEXT,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now()
);
```
### **Explanation of Each Column:**
- `id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE`
  - **Links the profile to the authenticated user.**
  - If a user is deleted, their profile is also deleted.
- `birthdate DATE NOT NULL`
  - Stores the **birthdate** for Mazzaroth tribe calculation.
- `tribe TEXT`
  - Stores the **assigned tribe**.
- `learning_path TEXT`
  - Stores the **chosen learning path**.
- `updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now()`
  - Tracks **when the profile was last updated**.

### **Step 3: Click "Run"**
- After running this query, the table will be created.

---

## **2Ô∏è‚É£ Add Row-Level Security (RLS)**
Since this table stores **user profiles**, we need **Row-Level Security (RLS)** so users can only update their own data.

### **Step 4: Enable RLS**
1. Go to **Database ‚Üí profiles**.
2. Under **Security**, enable **Row-Level Security** (RLS).

### **Step 5: Add a Policy**
Now, add a policy that **allows users to update their own profile**.

```sql
CREATE POLICY "Users can update their profile"
ON profiles
FOR UPDATE
USING (auth.uid() = id);
```

---

## **3Ô∏è‚É£ Test Table Exists**
Run this query to check:
```sql
SELECT * FROM profiles;
```
If you get **no relation found**, the table wasn‚Äôt created successfully.

---

## **4Ô∏è‚É£ Update Supabase Profile Save Code**
Now that the table exists, your `handleSubmit` function in **ProfileForm.js** will work.

```javascript
const getTribe = (birthdate) => {
  if (!birthdate) return null;
  
  const date = new Date(birthdate);
  const month = date.getMonth() + 1; // getMonth() is 0-based
  const day = date.getDate();

  return tribes.find(({ dateRange }) => {
    const [startMonth, startDay, endMonth, endDay] = dateRange;

    // Case 1: Tribe range is within the same year (e.g., Aries: March 21 - April 19)
    if (startMonth < endMonth || (startMonth === endMonth && startDay <= endDay)) {
      return (
        (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
        (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
        (month > startMonth && month < endMonth)

      (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) || 
      (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) || 
      (month >= startMonth || month <= endMonth)
    );
  });
};
```

#### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Incorrect Condition for Ranges Spanning Two Years**
This line is key:
```javascript

```
For **Asher (Dec 22 - Jan 19)**:

- But it must **NOT** include January 20+.

```javascript
    if (startMonth < endMonth) {
      return (
        (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
        (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
        (month > startMonth && month < endMonth)
      );

      return (
        (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
        (month === endMonth && day <= endDay)
      );
    }
  });
};
```

Error saving profile: new row violates row-level security policy for table "profiles"

---



---

This error occurs because **row-level security (RLS)** is enabled on the **`profiles`** table in Supabase, and your current **insert or update operation is not allowed** based on the policies set in Supabase.

---

### **üõ† Steps to Fix Row-Level Security Issue**
You need to **allow authenticated users** to insert and update their own profiles. Follow these steps:

---

### **‚úÖ 1. Check if RLS is Enabled on `profiles` Table**
1. Go to **Supabase Dashboard**.
2. Navigate to **Database > Tables**.
3. Select the **`profiles`** table.
4. Look for the **Row Level Security (RLS) toggle**.
5. If RLS is enabled (which it is by default), you need to **create policies**.

---

### **‚úÖ 2. Create RLS Policies for Authenticated Users**
Go to **Supabase SQL Editor** and run the following queries:

#### **üîπ Allow Users to Insert Their Own Profile**
```sql
create policy "Allow user to insert profile"
on profiles
for insert
with check (auth.uid() = id);
```
‚û°Ô∏è **This policy ensures that users can only insert a profile where their `id` matches their `auth.uid()`**.

#### **üîπ Allow Users to Update Their Own Profile**
```sql
create policy "Allow user to update their profile"
on profiles
for update
using (auth.uid() = id);
```
‚û°Ô∏è **This allows users to update their profile only if their `id` matches their Supabase `auth.uid()`**.

---

### **‚úÖ 3. Ensure Your Supabase Query Uses `auth.uid()`**
In **`ProfileForm.js`**, update the query so the **`id` field** in Supabase matches the authenticated user:

```javascript
async function handleSubmit(e) {
  e.preventDefault();

  if (!userId) {
    console.error("üö® No userId found. Cannot save profile.");
    alert("Error: No user found. Please log in.");
    return;
  }

  console.log("üì§ Submitting profile data...", { userId, birthdate, tribe, learningPath });

  const { data, error } = await supabase
    .from("profiles")
    .upsert({
      id: userId,  // Ensure this matches the Supabase auth user
      birthdate,
      tribe: tribe?.tribe || null,
      learning_path: learningPath || null,
      updated_at: new Date(),
    });

  if (error) {
    console.error("üî• Supabase error:", error);
    alert(`Error saving profile: ${error.message}`);
  } else {
    console.log("‚úÖ Profile updated successfully!", data);
    setIsSubmitted(true);
  }
}
```

---

4. Click **Save Profile**.

### **üîπ Updated `ProfileForm.js` with Navbar**
Modify **`app/components/ProfileForm.js`**:

```javascript
"use client";
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Image from "next/image";
import Navbar from "./Navbar";  // ‚úÖ Import Navbar

export default function ProfileForm({ userId }) {
  const router = useRouter();
  const [birthdate, setBirthdate] = useState("");
  const [tribe, setTribe] = useState(null);
  const [learningPath, setLearningPath] = useState("");
  const [step, setStep] = useState(1);
  const [isSubmitted, setIsSubmitted] = useState(false);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!birthdate) return;

    const date = new Date(birthdate);
    const month = date.getMonth() + 1;
    const day = date.getDate();

    const assignedTribe = tribes.find(({ dateRange }) => {
      const [startMonth, startDay, endMonth, endDay] = dateRange;
      return (
        (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
        (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
        (month > startMonth && month < endMonth) ||
        (startMonth > endMonth && (month >= startMonth || month <= endMonth))
      );
    });

    setTribe(assignedTribe || null);
  }, [birthdate]);

  async function handleSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();

    if (!userId) {
      alert("Error: No user found. Please log in.");
      return;
    }

    const { data, error } = await supabase
      .from("profiles")
      .upsert({
        id: userId,
        birthdate: birthdate ? new Date(birthdate).toISOString() : null,
        tribe: tribe?.tribe || null,
        learning_path: learningPath || null,
        updated_at: new Date().toISOString(),
      });

    if (error) {
      alert(`Error saving profile: ${error.message}`);
    } else {
      setIsSubmitted(true);
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <Navbar />  {/* ‚úÖ Added Navbar */}

      <div className="max-w-xl mx-auto p-6 bg-gray-800 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md mt-6">
        <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Complete Your Profile</h2>

        {/* Profile Form */}
        {!isSubmitted ? (
          <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-4">
            <label className="block">
              <span className="text-gray-300">Birthdate:</span>
              <input
                type="date"
                className="w-full px-4 py-2 rounded bg-gray-700 text-white"
                value={birthdate}
                onChange={(e) => setBirthdate(e.target.value)}
                required
              />
            </label>

            {tribe && (
              <div className="bg-gray-700 p-4 rounded-lg text-center">
                <h3 className="text-lg font-bold text-yellow-300">{tribe.tribe}</h3>
                <Image src={tribe.image} alt={tribe.tribe} width={120} height={120} className="mx-auto rounded-md mt-2" />
                <p className="text-sm italic mt-2">{tribe.blessing}</p>
              </div>
            )}

            <button type="submit" className="w-full bg-green-600 hover:bg-green-700 py-2 px-4 rounded text-white">
              Save Profile
            </button>
          </form>
        ) : (
          <div className="text-center">
            <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-yellow-300">Profile Completed!</h2>
            <p className="mt-2 text-gray-300">You have been assigned to the tribe of <strong>{tribe?.tribe}</strong>.</p>
            <button onClick={() => router.push("/members")} className="mt-4 bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 py-2 px-6 rounded text-white">
              Enter Members Area
            </button>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### **üìå How the Code Gets the Tribe Data**
1. **User selects a birthdate** from the date input field.

3. **The function `tribes.find()` searches** for the corresponding tribe based on the `dateRange`.

### **üõ† Breakdown of How Tribe Data is Retrieved**
```javascript
// Tribe Data Array
const tribes = [
  {
    tribe: "Benjamin",
    sign: "Aries",
    dateRange: [3, 21, 4, 19],  // March 21 - April 19
    animal: "Wolf / Ram",
    planet: "Ma'adim",
    mother: "Rachel",
    blessing: "Benjamin is a ravenous wolf...",
    description: "As a warrior tribe, Benjamin is fierce...",
    image: "/Benjamin.png",
  },
  {
    tribe: "Reuben",
    sign: "Aquarius",
    dateRange: [1, 20, 2, 18],  // January 20 - February 18
    animal: "Water Bearer",
    planet: "Oran",
    mother: "Leah",
    blessing: "Reuben, you are my firstborn...",
    description: "Reuben represents innovation...",
    image: "/Reuben.png",
  },
  // ... Other tribes ...
];

// üìå This `useEffect` runs when the birthdate changes
useEffect(() => {
  if (!birthdate) return;

  const date = new Date(birthdate);
  const month = date.getMonth() + 1; // ‚úÖ Adjusted for 1-based month
  const day = date.getDate();

  console.log(`üìÖ Selected Date: ${birthdate} ‚Üí Month: ${month}, Day: ${day}`);

  // üîç Find the corresponding tribe in the `tribes` array
  const assignedTribe = tribes.find(({ dateRange }) => {
    const [startMonth, startDay, endMonth, endDay] = dateRange;

    if (startMonth < endMonth) {
      return (
        (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
        (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
        (month > startMonth && month < endMonth)
      );
    } else {
      return (
        (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
        (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
        (month === 12 && startMonth === 12 && month >= startMonth) || // December case
        (month === 1 && endMonth === 1 && month <= endMonth) // January case
      );
    }
  });

  console.log(`‚úÖ Assigned Tribe: ${assignedTribe?.tribe || "None"}`);

  if (assignedTribe) {
    setTribe(assignedTribe); // ‚úÖ Update the state with the found tribe
  } else {
    console.warn("üö® No tribe assigned!");
  }
}, [birthdate]); // Runs whenever birthdate changes
```

5. **The UI updates, showing the assigned tribe.**

- **Import** `tribes.js` in `ProfileForm.js`
