### **üìå Updated `ProfileForm.js`**
```javascript
"use client";
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Image from "next/image";
import Navbar from "./Navbar";  
import tribes from "@/lib/tribes"; // ‚úÖ Import Tribe Data

export default function ProfileForm({ userId }) {
  const router = useRouter();
  const [birthdate, setBirthdate] = useState("");
  const [tribe, setTribe] = useState(null);
  const [learningPath, setLearningPath] = useState("");
  const [isSubmitted, setIsSubmitted] = useState(false);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!birthdate) return;

    const date = new Date(birthdate);
    const month = date.getMonth() + 1; // ‚úÖ Ensure 1-based month
    const day = date.getDate();

    // ‚úÖ Use the same method as in celestial/page.js
    const assignedTribe = tribes.find(({ dateRange }) => {
      const [startMonth, startDay, endMonth, endDay] = dateRange;
      
      if (startMonth < endMonth) {
        return (
          (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
          (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
          (month > startMonth && month < endMonth)
        );
      } else {
        return (
          (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
          (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
          (month === 12 && startMonth === 12 && month >= startMonth) || // December edge case
          (month === 1 && endMonth === 1 && month <= endMonth) // January edge case
        );
      }
    });

    setTribe(assignedTribe || null);
  }, [birthdate]);

  async function handleSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();

    if (!userId) {
      alert("Error: No user found. Please log in.");
      return;
    }

    const { data, error } = await supabase
      .from("profiles")
      .upsert({
        id: userId,
        birthdate: birthdate ? new Date(birthdate).toISOString() : null,
        tribe: tribe?.tribe || null,
        learning_path: learningPath || null,
        updated_at: new Date().toISOString(),
      });

    if (error) {
      alert(`Error saving profile: ${error.message}`);
    } else {
      setIsSubmitted(true);
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-900 text-white">
      <Navbar />

      <div className="max-w-xl mx-auto p-6 bg-gray-800 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md mt-6">
        <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Complete Your Profile</h2>

        {!isSubmitted ? (
          <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-4">
            <label className="block">
              <span className="text-gray-300">Birthdate:</span>
              <input
                type="date"
                className="w-full px-4 py-2 rounded bg-gray-700 text-white"
                value={birthdate}
                onChange={(e) => setBirthdate(e.target.value)}
                required
              />
            </label>

            {tribe && (
              <div className="bg-gray-700 p-4 rounded-lg text-center">
                <h3 className="text-lg font-bold text-yellow-300">{tribe.tribe}</h3>
                <Image src={tribe.image} alt={tribe.tribe} width={120} height={120} className="mx-auto rounded-md mt-2" />
                <p className="text-sm italic mt-2">{tribe.blessing}</p>
              </div>
            )}

            <button type="submit" className="w-full bg-green-600 hover:bg-green-700 py-2 px-4 rounded text-white">
              Save Profile
            </button>
          </form>
        ) : (
          <div className="text-center">
            <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-yellow-300">Profile Completed!</h2>
            <p className="mt-2 text-gray-300">You have been assigned to the tribe of <strong>{tribe?.tribe}</strong>.</p>
            <button onClick={() => router.push("/members")} className="mt-4 bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 py-2 px-6 rounded text-white">
              Enter Members Area
            </button>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## **üîπ Fixing Tribe Placement Logic in `ProfileForm.js`**
Your **tribe selection logic** in `ProfileForm.js` is **not properly mapping dates**. We need to ensure it correctly **pulls from `tribes.js`**.

### **üîç Fix: Tribe Calculation**
Here‚Äôs how we **correctly assign a tribe** based on **birthdate input**:
```javascript
"use client";
import { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import Image from "next/image";
import Navbar from "./Navbar";
import tribes from "@/lib/tribes"; // ‚úÖ Import Tribe Data

export default function ProfileForm({ userId }) {
    const [birthdate, setBirthdate] = useState("");
    const [tribe, setTribe] = useState(null);
    const [learningPath, setLearningPath] = useState("");

    useEffect(() => {
        if (!birthdate) return;

        const date = new Date(birthdate);
        const month = date.getMonth() + 1; // ‚úÖ Ensure correct month indexing (1-based)
        const day = date.getDate();

        const assignedTribe = tribes.find(({ dateRange }) => {
            const [startMonth, startDay, endMonth, endDay] = dateRange;

            // üü¢ Fix: Ensure proper date comparison
            if (startMonth < endMonth) {
                return (
                    (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
                    (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
                    (month > startMonth && month < endMonth)
                );
            } else {
                return (
                    (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
                    (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
                    (month === 12 && startMonth === 12 && month >= startMonth) ||
                    (month === 1 && endMonth === 1 && month <= endMonth)
                );
            }
        });

        setTribe(assignedTribe || null);
    }, [birthdate]);

    const handleSubmit = async (e) => {
        e.preventDefault();

        if (!tribe || !birthdate || !learningPath) {
            alert("Please complete all fields before submitting.");
            return;
        }

        // üîπ Save profile to Supabase
        const { error } = await supabase
            .from("profiles")
            .upsert([
                { id: userId, birthdate, tribe: tribe.tribe, learning_path: learningPath }
            ]);

        if (error) {
            console.error("üî• Supabase error:", error);
            alert("Error saving profile: " + error.message);
        } else {
            alert("Profile updated successfully!");
        }
    };

    return (
        <div className="min-h-screen text-white">
            <Navbar />

            <div className="text-center py-8">
                <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold text-yellow-400">Complete Your Profile</h1>
                <p className="text-lg mt-2 text-gray-300 max-w-3xl mx-auto">
                    Enter your birthdate to find your tribe and begin your spiritual journey.
                </p>
            </div>

            <div className="text-center mt-6">
                <label className="text-xl">Enter Your Birth Date:</label>
                <input
                    type="date"
                    className="bg-gray-700 p-2 rounded text-black mx-2"
                    onChange={(e) => setBirthdate(e.target.value)}
                />
```

To ensure that **authenticated users** can update their profiles in Supabase, you need to create a **Row Level Security (RLS) policy** that allows users to update only their own records.

### **üü¢ Fix: Add Row-Level Security (RLS) Policy**
Run the following **SQL query** inside Supabase **SQL Editor**:

```sql
CREATE POLICY "Allow users to update their profile"
ON "public"."profiles"
AS PERMISSIVE
FOR UPDATE
TO authenticated
USING (auth.uid() = id)
WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
```

### **üîπ Explanation of the Policy**
- ‚úÖ **`AS PERMISSIVE`** ‚Üí Allows the update if the condition is met.
- ‚úÖ **`FOR UPDATE`** ‚Üí Only applies to `UPDATE` queries (users can update but not delete or insert).
- ‚úÖ **`TO authenticated`** ‚Üí Restricts this policy to signed-in users.
- ‚úÖ **`USING (auth.uid() = id)`** ‚Üí Ensures the user can only update their **own profile**.
- ‚úÖ **`WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id)`** ‚Üí Ensures the row being updated **belongs to the authenticated user**.

### **üõ†Ô∏è Steps to Apply This Fix**
1Ô∏è‚É£ **Go to Supabase Dashboard**  
2Ô∏è‚É£ **Navigate to `profiles` table**  
3Ô∏è‚É£ **Click on `RLS (Row Level Security)` tab**  
4Ô∏è‚É£ **Run the above SQL command in SQL Editor**  
5Ô∏è‚É£ **Ensure RLS is enabled** for the `profiles` table  
6Ô∏è‚É£ **Test updating a profile** from your frontend.

üöÄ **Once applied, your users should be able to update their profiles correctly!** Let me know if you need further debugging.

### **üö® Fix: Supabase Error - "column 'user_id' does not exist"**

The error occurs because **Supabase uses `id` as the user identifier, not `user_id`**.  
To fix this, update your policy to reference **`id` instead of `user_id`**.

---

### **‚úÖ Correct SQL Policy for INSERT**
Run the following SQL command in **Supabase SQL Editor**:

```sql
create policy "Enable insert for users based on id"
on "public"."profiles"
as PERMISSIVE
for INSERT
to authenticated
with check (auth.uid() = id);
```

---

### **üîπ Explanation**
- ‚úÖ **Ensures only authenticated users can insert.**
- ‚úÖ **`auth.uid()` (Supabase's way of identifying the logged-in user) must match the `id` field in `profiles`.**
- ‚úÖ **Fixes the "column user_id does not exist" error by using `id` instead.**

whats the difference here: INSERT
Enable insert for authenticated users only
This policy gives insert access to your table for all authenticated users only.


INSERT
Enable insert for users based on user_id
This policy assumes that your table has a column "user_id", and allows users to insert rows which the "user_id" column matches their ID

---

### **üîç Difference Between These Two Supabase Policies:**
Both policies control **INSERT permissions**, but they differ in how they determine **who can insert data**.

---

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ "Enable insert for authenticated users only"**
This policy allows **all authenticated users** to insert data into the table **without checking if the row belongs to them**.

‚úÖ **Who can insert?**  
- Any authenticated user (anyone logged in).  
- They can insert **any data**, even if it doesn‚Äôt belong to them.

‚úÖ **Example SQL Policy:**
```sql
create policy "Enable insert for authenticated users only"
on "public"."profiles"
as PERMISSIVE
for INSERT
to authenticated
with check (true);
```
‚úÖ **Use Case:**  
- Good for tables where **any authenticated user can contribute** (e.g., a public comments section).
- Not ideal for user-specific data like profiles.

---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ "Enable insert for users based on user_id"**
This policy **restricts inserts to only allow users to insert rows where `user_id` matches their own user ID**.

‚ùå **Issue:** Supabase **does not use `user_id`** by default. It uses `id`.  
‚úÖ **Fix:** If your `profiles` table has an `id` column linked to the user's **auth.uid()**, then use this:

‚úÖ **Corrected SQL Policy:**
```sql
create policy "Enable insert for users based on id"
on "public"."profiles"
as PERMISSIVE
for INSERT
to authenticated
with check (auth.uid() = id);
```

‚úÖ **Who can insert?**  
- Only authenticated users.  
- Users **can only insert their own profile**, **not someone else‚Äôs**.

‚úÖ **Use Case:**  
- Perfect for **user profiles** (each user can only insert their own profile data).
- Ensures users **cannot impersonate another user**.

---

### **üí° Which One Should You Use?**
For **user profiles**, use **"Enable insert for users based on id"** to prevent users from inserting data for others. üöÄ

To confirm your **Git sign-in** in VS Code, follow these steps:

---

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ Check Your Git User Configuration**
Open **VS Code's terminal** and run:
```sh
git config --global user.name
git config --global user.email
```
- If this prints your name and email, Git is correctly configured.
- If it's empty, set them using:
  ```sh
  git config --global user.name "Your Name"
  git config --global user.email "your@email.com"
  ```

---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Verify Git Authentication**
Run:
```sh
git credential reject https://github.com
git credential approve https://github.com
```
Then, try:
```sh
git pull
```
- If Git prompts for authentication, **enter your GitHub username and Personal Access Token (PAT)** (not your password).
- If you are already authenticated, the pull should succeed.

---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Check GitHub Authentication**
Run:
```sh
git remote -v
```
- If it shows `origin https://github.com/...`, you‚Äôre using **HTTPS** (which requires a token).
- If it shows `origin git@github.com:...`, you‚Äôre using **SSH** (which requires an SSH key).

To test your **GitHub SSH authentication**, run:
```sh
ssh -T git@github.com
```
- If you see **"Hi username! You've successfully authenticated"**, SSH is working.
- If it says **"Permission denied (publickey)"**, you may need to add your SSH key to GitHub.

---

### **4Ô∏è‚É£ Reauthenticate Git in VS Code**
If you're having issues, try signing in again:
1. **Sign in via GitHub CLI**  
   ```sh
   gh auth login
   ```
   - Follow the prompts to authenticate with your GitHub account.

2. **Re-authenticate Git credentials** (for HTTPS users):
   ```sh
   git credential reject https://github.com
   git credential approve https://github.com
   ```

3. **If using HTTPS and still facing issues, store your credentials**:
   ```sh
   git config --global credential.helper store
   ```
   Then run:
   ```sh
   git push
   ```
   - It will ask for your **GitHub username and token** (not password).  
   - Once entered, credentials will be saved for future use.

---

### **5Ô∏è‚É£ Restart VS Code and Try Again**
- **Close VS Code** completely.
- **Reopen it** and try a `git push` or `git pull` again.

### **‚úÖ Fix It**

```sh
git push --set-upstream origin main
```
or, shorthand:
```sh
git push -u origin main
```

### **üìå Explanation**
- The **`-u`** (or `--set-upstream`) option tells Git to remember the remote branch (`origin/main`), so next time, you can just run:
  ```sh
  git push
  ```
  without needing to specify the remote.

Once you set this up, Git will remember the upstream branch and allow seamless pushing in the future.

can things be auto pushed?

---

Yes, you can **auto-push** changes to GitHub whenever you commit changes by setting up **Git auto-push**.

---

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ Enable Auto-Push for Every Commit**
You can configure Git to **automatically push after every commit** using:
```sh
git config --global push.autoSetupRemote true
```
This means that **after every commit**, you don‚Äôt have to manually run `git push`.

---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ Using Git Hooks for Auto Push**
If you want Git to push automatically **after each commit**, you can use a Git hook.

#### **üîπ Steps to Set Up Auto-Push Using Git Hook**
1. Open the terminal and navigate to your repository:
   ```sh
   cd /path/to/your/project
   ```
2. Create or edit the **post-commit** hook:
   ```sh
   nano .git/hooks/post-commit
   ```
3. Add the following script to **auto-push** after every commit:
   ```sh
   #!/bin/sh
   git push origin main
   ```
4. Save and exit (in Nano: `CTRL+X`, then `Y`, then `Enter`).
5. Make the script executable:
   ```sh
   chmod +x .git/hooks/post-commit
   ```

‚úÖ Now, every time you commit (`git commit -m "your message"`), Git will **automatically push to the remote repository**.

---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Auto-Push with Vercel Deployment**
If you want **automatic deployment** after each push, **Vercel** allows automatic deployments via **GitHub Integration**:
1. Go to **Vercel Dashboard** ‚Üí Select your project.
2. Click on **"Settings"** ‚Üí **"Git"**.
3. Enable **"Auto-Deploy on Push"**.

Now, every push to GitHub will **automatically trigger a new deployment**.

---

### **4Ô∏è‚É£ Using a Cron Job (If Running a Server)**
If you want **Git to push automatically at intervals**, use a **cron job**.

1. Open your cron editor:
   ```sh
   crontab -e
   ```
2. Add a line to push every 10 minutes:
   ```sh
   */10 * * * * cd /path/to/your/repo && git add . && git commit -m "Auto-commit" && git push origin main
   ```
3. Save and exit.

üöÄ **Now Git will push every 10 minutes automatically!**

---

### **üéØ Final Thoughts**
- **For auto-push after each commit:** Use the `post-commit` Git hook.
- **For automatic deployment:** Use **Vercel's Auto-Deploy** feature.
- **For scheduled pushing:** Use a **cron job**.

### **Steps to Commit and Push Using VS Code Source Control**
1. **Open Source Control**  
   - Click on the **Source Control** tab in VS Code (or press `Ctrl + Shift + G` on Windows/Linux or `Cmd + Shift + G` on Mac).
   
2. **Enter a Commit Message**  
   - In the message box at the top of the Source Control panel, **type a short description** of the changes (e.g., `"Updated profile page logic"`).

3. **Commit Changes**  
   - Click the **‚úîÔ∏è (checkmark) button** or press `Cmd + Enter` (Mac) / `Ctrl + Enter` (Windows/Linux).

4. **Push to GitHub**  
   - Click the **"Sync Changes"** button (üîÉ) at the top, or manually push using:
     ```sh
     git push origin main
     ```
   - If Git prompts for authentication, log in with your **GitHub credentials**.

---

### **Alternative: Commit via Terminal**
If you prefer using the terminal, **run these commands manually**:
```sh
git add .
git commit -m "Updated profile page logic"
git push origin main
```

### **Step 1: Create a Shared Function for Tribe Assignment**
To **avoid inconsistencies**, let's move the tribe assignment logic into **`/lib/tribes.js`** so both `ProfileForm.js` and `CelestialTribes.js` can import and use it.

üîπ **Edit `/lib/tribes.js`**
```javascript
export function getTribeByBirthdate(selectedDate) {
    if (!selectedDate) return null;
    const date = new Date(selectedDate);
    const month = date.getMonth() + 1; // ‚úÖ Convert to 1-based month
    const day = date.getDate();

    return tribes.find(({ dateRange }) => {
        const [startMonth, startDay, endMonth, endDay] = dateRange;
        
        return (
            (month === startMonth && day >= startDay) ||
            (month === endMonth && day <= endDay) ||
            (month > startMonth && month < endMonth) ||
            (startMonth > endMonth && (month >= startMonth || month <= endMonth)) // ‚úÖ Handle Dec-Jan case
        );
    });
}
```

```javascript
export function getTribeByBirthdate(selectedDate) {
    if (!selectedDate) return null;
    const date = new Date(selectedDate);
    const month = date.getMonth() + 1; // ‚úÖ Convert to 1-based month
    const day = date.getDate();

            (month > startMonth && month < endMonth) ||

    });
}
```

```javascript
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import Navbar from "../components/Navbar";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profileComplete, setProfileComplete] = useState(false);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchUser() {
      setLoading(true);
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();
      if (error) console.error("Error fetching user:", error.message);
      if (data?.session?.user) {
        setUser(data.session.user);
        checkProfileCompletion(data.session.user.id);
      } else {
        router.replace("/login");
      }
      setLoading(false);
    }

    async function checkProfileCompletion(userId) {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from("profiles")
        .select("birthdate, tribe, learning_path")
        .eq("id", userId)
        .single();

      if (data && data.birthdate && data.tribe && data.learning_path) {
        setProfileComplete(true);
      } else {
        router.push("/profile-setup");
      }
    }

    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    router.push("/login");
  }

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen text-white">
      <Navbar /> {/* ‚úÖ Navigation added */}
      <h2 className="text-3xl text-center mt-4">Welcome, {user?.email}</h2>
    </div>
  );
}
```

   - ‚úÖ If `Navbar.js` is inside `components/` (outside `app/`):

### **üìú Full Code for `/app/members/page.js`**
```jsx
"use client";
import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import { supabase } from "@/lib/supabaseClient";
import Navbar from "@/app/components/Navbar";
import Link from "next/link";

export default function MembersArea() {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const [profile, setProfile] = useState(null);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    async function fetchUser() {
      setLoading(true);
      const { data, error } = await supabase.auth.getSession();
      if (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching user session:", error.message);
        setLoading(false);
        return;
      }

      if (data?.session?.user) {
        setUser(data.session.user);
        fetchProfile(data.session.user.id);
      } else {
        router.replace("/login");
      }
    }

    async function fetchProfile(userId) {
      const { data, error } = await supabase
        .from("profiles")
        .select("birthdate, tribe, learning_path")
        .eq("id", userId)
        .single();

      if (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching profile:", error.message);
      } else if (data) {
        setProfile(data);
      } else {
        router.push("/profile-setup");
      }
      setLoading(false);
    }

    fetchUser();
  }, [router]);

  async function handleLogout() {
    await supabase.auth.signOut();
    router.push("/login");
  }

  if (loading) return <p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>;
  if (!user) return null;

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen text-white flex flex-col bg-gray-900">
      {/* üîπ Navbar */}
      <Navbar />

      {/* üîπ Member Dashboard */}
      <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-center flex-grow text-center p-6">
        <h2 className="text-4xl font-bold text-yellow-400">Welcome, {user.email}</h2>
        {profile ? (
          <>
            <p className="text-lg mt-3">
              You are on your journey in the Tribe of{" "}
              <span className="font-semibold text-yellow-300">{profile.tribe}</span>.
            </p>
            <p className="text-lg">
              Your Learning Path:{" "}
              <span className="font-semibold text-green-300">{profile.learning_path || "Not Selected"}</span>
            </p>

            {/* üîπ Navigation Buttons */}
            <div className="mt-6 space-x-4">
              <Link href="/profile-setup">
                <button className="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-600 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded-lg">
                  Update Profile
                </button>
              </Link>
              <Link href={`/learning-path?path=${profile.learning_path}`}>
                <button className="bg-green-500 hover:bg-green-600 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded-lg">
                  Continue Learning
                </button>
              </Link>
            </div>
          </>
        ) : (
          <p className="text-lg mt-4">No profile data found. Redirecting to setup...</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* üîπ Logout Button */}
      <div className="text-center mt-6">
        <button
          onClick={handleLogout}
          className="bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded-lg"
        >
          Logout
        </button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

---

### **üìå What This Code Does**
‚úÖ **Loads user authentication session**  
‚úÖ **Checks if user profile exists** (birthdate, tribe, learning path)  
‚úÖ **Redirects user to `/profile-setup` if profile is incomplete**  
‚úÖ **Displays tribe and learning path dynamically**  
‚úÖ **Provides links to update profile & continue learning**  
‚úÖ **Includes Logout button**  

This **ensures a fully functional** Members Page, ready for navigation and progression! üöÄ

### **‚úÖ Solution: Update `/app/learning-path/page.js`**
```jsx
"use client";
import { Suspense } from "react";
import { useSearchParams } from "next/navigation";

function LearningPathContent() {
  const searchParams = useSearchParams();
  const learningPath = searchParams.get("path");

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen text-white flex flex-col items-center justify-center bg-gray-900">
      <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold text-yellow-400">
        Your Learning Path: {learningPath || "Not Selected"}
      </h1>
      <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-2">
        Here you will find courses and materials to guide your journey.
      </p>
      {/* TODO: Dynamically load course content based on learningPath */}
    </div>
  );
}

export default function LearningPath() {
  return (
    <Suspense fallback={<p className="text-center text-white">Loading...</p>}>
      <LearningPathContent />
    </Suspense>
  );
}
```

---

### **üîπ What This Fix Does**
‚úî **Wraps `useSearchParams()` inside a `Suspense` component**  
‚úî **Prevents build errors due to missing Suspense boundary**  
‚úî **Ensures smooth Client-Side Rendering (CSR)**  

This should **resolve the build error** and allow `/learning-path` to function properly. üöÄ
